bought the game last year during the christmas sale on steam, ran just fine

recently tried playing it again and it keeps on crashing

only change to my pc is 560ti out, 970 in.

If i run the game through steam, the game freezes on loading into a saved game, if i launch it normally, it will loade into the game, but just randomly crash after a few mins.

pc setup:

i5 2500k

gtx 970

8gig ram

not sure whats causing this, i added the crash-folder ksp generated in the dropbox link

ty in advance

First things first, you've got several mods throwing exceptions -- either update them (they seem to be out of date) and let me know so I can move this thread to a more appropriate section, or clear out your GameData folder so it contains only the Squad and NasaMission folders. Once you've done either of these things, try it again. If it continues to crash, please post the new logs.

In addition, the x64 build of the game is extremely unstable at present, so I must recommend you run the x32 build of the game rather than the x64.

oh, i tought i deleted all the mods, sorry for that. feel free to move the thread .

i'll start by clearing all those mods out

- - - Updated - - -

cleared the mods out, (were old versions of mechjeb/kerbal alarm clock)

game still freezes stops working, but doesn't crash now.

it freezes right before i actually get ingame; i can see the loading thingie on the bottom right, some of the ui elements on the top, and sometimes bill's message appears. then it just stops working.

but since it doesn,'t crash now, i don't get a crash report :x

also notice with an overlay from my graphics card that my fps drops to anywhere between 0 and 15

You should be able to grab the output_log.txt from the KSP_Data folder even if it doesn't actually crash. It might be worth seeing if disabling your graphics card's overlay entirely helps with the freezing. I know having any overlay other than Steam's own overlay present tends to cause a whole bunch of issues for me, so it might be a similar thing.

turning the fps-counter-overlay off didn't help either

this is a pastebin copy-paste of the output_log

http://pastebin.com/pTx6RcwX

Did you run the x32 version instead of the x64?

Since you got it on steam, go to:

Computer/Programs (X86)/Steam/SteamApps/Common/Kerbal Space Program

It's somewhere in there. Click on KSP.exe instead of KSP.exe 64 bit or something like that.

Good luck

tried running through steam, through the launcher, through both of the exes, even through nvidia geforce experience, always the same result

it hangs on this screen : http://puu.sh/e9zEj/e3e6a2f140.png

sounds just keep playing ( i can hear the birds)

even just deleted all the files and reinstalled, same thing

Try this:

Right click on the game on the steam library

Click Properties

Click on the local files tab (I think that's it)

Then click "Verify integrity of game cache" (Something like that)

Wait for it to finish, and try again.

If that doesnt work:

Right click the game in the steam library

Properties

Click local files and delete local game content.

Reinstall and try that.

If that STILL doesnt work, tell me on this thread.

tried that a few times, nothing :/ still freezes on the same screen that i posted above.

ty for the help so far tho
You mentioned something about changing someting on your computer. Could you change it back?
the one thing i changed about my computer is that i replaced my GTX 560 TI with a GTX 970, so nope, can't unchange that
Have you tried sending an email to the support team?
It would be a good idea to make sure KSP is in your antivirus' Ignore List/Whitelist; some antiviruses can cause Unity programs to screw up, and KSP is no exception.
